StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.name: [sp_UpdateMaster8412DataLog]
StoredProcedureSqlServerv2k5.body:
@FileName varchar(250), @Status int, @UserLogin varchar(15) AS
DECLARE @CheckedOutStatusID int DECLARE @CheckedInStatusID int DECLARE @CurrentStatus int DECLARE @LogID int
--- GET THE STATUS ID FOR CHECKED OUT AND CHECKED IN FILES SELECT @CheckedOutStatusID = MCD_MASTER_DATA_FILE_STATUS_ID FROM MASTER_8412_DATA_FILE_STATUS WHERE FILE_STATUS = 'CHECKED OUT' SELECT @CheckedInStatusID = MCD_MASTER_DATA_FILE_STATUS_ID FROM MASTER_8412_DATA_FILE_STATUS WHERE FILE_STATUS = 'CHECKED IN'
--- GET THE CURRENT LOG ID FOR THE SPECIFIED FILE SELECT @LogID = MAX(MASTER_8412_DATA_LOG_ID) FROM MASTER_8412_DATA_LOG WHERE [FILE_NAME] = @FileName
--- GET THE STATUS OF THE SPECIFIED FILE SELECT @CurrentStatus = L.FILE_STATUS_ID FROM MASTER_8412_DATA_LOG L WHERE L.MASTER_8412_DATA_LOG_ID = @LogID
--- IF THE FILE IS CURRENTLY CHECKED OUT --- UPDATE THE RECORD IF IT'S BEING CHECKED IN IF @CurrentStatus = @CheckedOutStatusID AND @Status = @CheckedInStatusID BEGIN UPDATE MASTER_8412_DATA_LOG SET FILE_STATUS_ID = @Status, USER_LOGIN = @UserLogin, UPDATE_DATE = GETDATE() WHERE MASTER_8412_DATA_LOG_ID = @LogID END ELSE BEGIN --- ADD A NEW ENTRY TO THE LOG IF THE STATUS OF THE FILE CHANGES (e.g., IF THE FILE IS CHECKED OUT) IF @CurrentStatus = @CheckedInStatusID AND @Status = @CheckedOutStatusID BEGIN INSERT INTO MASTER_8412_DATA_LOG ([FILE_NAME], FILE_STATUS_ID, USER_LOGIN, UPDATE_DATE) VALUES (@FileName, @Status, @UserLogin, GETDATE()) END END
